body.p: Plugin command to clean up a storage plugin after backup.

section.title: Description
section.p: gpbackup invokes the cleanup_plugin_for_backup plugin command on the master and all segment hosts when a gpbackup operation completes, both in success and failure cases.

The cleanup_plugin_for_backup command should perform the actions necessary to clean up the remote storage system after a backup. Clean up activities may include removing remote directories or temporary files created during the backup, disconnecting from the backup service, etc.

plentry.pd: The absolute path to the plugin configuration YAML file.
The local directory on the Greenplum Database host (master and segments) to which gpbackup wrote backup files.

section.title: Exit Code
section.p: The cleanup_plugin_for_backup command must exit with a value of 0 on success, non-zero if an error occurs. In the case of a non-zero exit code, gpbackup displays the contents of stderr to the user.
